title: Authority to reunite; placement
context: [ยง587D-6] Authority to reunite; placement. (a) Upon receiving custody of a newborn child who has been discharged from a hospital that received the newborn child pursuant to section 587D-3, the department may reunite the newborn child with the newborn&rsquo;s parents. (b) The department may: (1) Search for relatives of the newborn child as a placement or permanency option; or (2) Implement other placement requirements that give a preference to relatives; provided that the department has information as to the identity of the newborn child, the newborn child&rsquo;s mother, or the newborn child&rsquo;s father.
